body: [GitMate.io](https://gitmate.io) thinks possibly related issues are https://github.com/pytest-dev/pytest/issues/3037 (caplog fixture: capture log records from another process), https://github.com/pytest-dev/pytest/issues/891 (remove named marker attributes and collect markers in items), https://github.com/pytest-dev/pytest/issues/3080 (Remove pytest_namespace), https://github.com/pytest-dev/pytest/issues/3083 (Remove metafunc.addcall), and https://github.com/pytest-dev/pytest/issues/3079 (Remove yield tests).

> OR add this one, which will work also for clients holding handler's stream property:

This seems like a nice solution (@thisch what do you think?). ~~@ankostis you have done some researching here, would you like to work on a PR?~~ Sorry nevermind, only now I noticed that @thisch has already self-assigned this issue. ðŸ˜‰

I'm for reinitializing the stream, hence not using truncate. See https://stackoverflow.com/questions/4330812/how-do-i-clear-a-stringio-object#4330829

@ankostis If you want to work on this I can unassign myself. (I'll probably not have time to work on it soon)
You can take a look at my commit (62b224b)

issue.title: Fix #3297 where caplog.clear() did not clear text, just records

repository.name: pytest
repository.description: The pytest framework makes it easy to write small tests, yet scales to support complex functional testing

issue.body:
Fix #3297 where ``caplog.clear()`` did not clear text, just records.  
Fix by @thisch that re-installs a new ``StringIO`` on the handler as suggested in https://stackoverflow.com/questions/4330812/how-do-i-clear-a-stringio-object#4330829
+ Actually work delegated to a new `reset()` method on the handler, used also on `caplog` construction .
+ Added TC demonstrating failure.

body:
Oups, i see now my changelog change is forbiden.  Rewritting history without it.

Use this if useful:

```rst
- Fix ``clear()`` method on ``caplog`` fixture which cleared only the ``records``,
  and not the ``text```property. (`#3297
  <https://github.com/pytest-dev/pytest/issues/3297>`_)
```

> Oups, i see now my changelog change is forbiden

Hmm it seems your markup around *text*  has an extra backtick and failed to parse. Also don't need to add the link to #3297 because this is added automatically.

I suggested a changelog entry on my review because I did not see your comment here, so feel free to use your initial take instead of mine:

```rst
Fixed ``clear()`` method on ``caplog`` fixture which cleared only the ``records`` attribute but not the ``text`` property.
```
